creator: andyt@ualloyalty.com
text:
I have apache-2.0.43 + mod_jk 4.1.18 compiled on Solaris 8 in 64-bit mode. Tomcat runs both on the local machine, and on a remote. If a worker is configured to connect to tomcat on the local machine, it works fine. When configured to connect to tomcat on a remote machine, it fails.
If apache and mod_jk are compiled on the same box in 32-bit mode, then it works fine both against local and remote tomcat. 32-bit compilation is forced by using -m32 flag.

System description:
root@mpwww10:~# uname -a
SunOS mpwww10.mpstage.com 5.8 Generic_108528-16 sun4u sparc SUNW,UltraSPARC-IIi-cEngine
root@mpwww10:~# gcc -v
Reading specs from /usr/local/lib/gcc-lib/sparcv9-sun-solaris2.8/3.0.4/specs
Configured with: ./configure --host=sparcv9-sun-solaris2.8
Thread model: posix
gcc version 3.0.4

creator: truk@apache.org
text:
A similar problem was noticed on OpenBSD/sparc64 and fixed in mod_jk version 
1.2.5. Please don't reopen this report until you have reconfirmed it is still a 
problem in 1.2.5 AND provide more information (log & configuration files etc).
